attributes.action: Provide a greater access to asylum for Iraqi refugees, to at minimum, UN recommendations
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Under the 4th Geneva Convention, the Coalition and hence the U.K, has obligations to the civilian population of Iraq as the occupying power. The lack of security in Iraq which the Coalition has failed to remedy to date, has created some 2million or more refugees for which the UN notes the UK has failed to offer asylum to sufficient numbers of Iraqis.

The UK must endeavour to meet these obligations of international law and humanitarian conscience and grant access to at least the number of Iraqi refugees implied by the United Nations.
